span.p: Yesterday, Governor Wolf announced the closing of all Pennsylvania schools until further notice. Williamsburg Community School District will continue to offer enrichment and review activities through Google Classroom for all students in grades K-12. Paper/pencil packets will be available for students in Grades K-6 and can be picked up on Mondays at the elementary school during Grab and Go meal distribution from 11:00-12:30. Parents/Guardians with students in Grades 7-12 can call the high school office to make arrangements for paper/pencil activity packets.

a.title: Go to comments for 3/31/20 update

span.p:
We are certainly in a time of uncertainty as we navigate through the ever changing COVID-19 situation. As you are aware, Williamsburg Community School District is closed through April 6, 2020 with students to return on April 9, 2020. The administration and staff have been working during this closure to prepare enrichment and review activities to all students in grades K-12 through Google Classroom. Beginning Monday, March 30, 2020, all teachers will send out enrichment and review activities through Google Classroom. Teachers will provide activities to all students on Mondays and Wednesdays. There will be enough activities for students to work on Monday through Friday. Teachers will be available from 9:00am to 12:00pm Monday through Friday to answer any questions you or your child may have about the activities. Directions on how to access your child’s Google Classroom account are attached to this email. If you have difficulty accessing you child’s Google account, please email Mr. Jones or Mrs. Metzler for assistance.
The decision to provide enrichment and review activities was made with guidance from the Pennsylvania Department of Education. This method of education is to provide students with activities to review what was previously taught and to extend knowledge of what was previously taught. We ask that you please be patient with this online process as it is new to everyone. Teachers are working very hard to provide meaningful, high quality activities to their students. There will be some bumps along the way, but we will work through it.
For our special education students, online supports will be provided to support students through the Google Classroom activities. Learning Support Teachers will be communicating regularly with their students supporting their needs to complete activities and be successful. Gifted education students will also receive communication and enrichment activities from the Gifted Support Teacher through Google Classroom.
Finally, the District will accommodate any family who does not have access to Internet and Google Classroom. Paper/pencil packets will be available for students in grades K-6 on Monday, March 30, 2020 during the distribution of Grab and Go meals at the elementary school from 11:00-12:30. Packet distribution will be every Monday during this time. Families of students in grades 7-12, please notify the school office, or if able, email the principal, to make arrangements for distribution of paper/pencil packets for your child.
Please do not hesitate to contact Mr. Jones, Mrs. Metzler or myself with any questions or concerns you may have. We will navigate this new way of educating students together with the support of one another!

div.p:
Take care and sharing the Blue Pirate Spirit,
Lisa Murgas
Superintendent

hr.p: Please be reminded that the Williamsburg Community School District will be utilizing the One Call Now communication system to notify families of school delays and closings. The communication system will also be used to notify families of other notifications including emergencies and attendance. Notifications will be sent to the phone numbers you have registered with One Call Now from the information that was sent home at the beginning of the year. If you did not register any phone numbers, a notification will be sent to the primary phone number on file. It is extremely important to notify either the elementary or high school office any time you have a change in phone number. If you did not register any phone numbers with One Call Now and would like to, please call the school office.

Also, if you choose, you can receive text alerts in addition to phone calls. If you would like to receive text alerts, simply text “alert” to the number 22300. Once initiated, you will receive a text message reply from One Call Now. It may state, “message and data rates may apply.” If you have unlimited text messaging on your cellular plan, this should not apply. If you have limited text messaging, rates may apply. Please verify with your cellular plan carrier before setting up text alerts.
One Call Now notifications will come from the school’s phone number, 832-2125. If you do not answer the call, the notification will go to voicemail.

A test notification call was made on Thursday, November 17th. If you did not receive a test call, please notify the school office. Test calls will continue over the next week to ensure families are receiving notifications.
